page.title: 02PORTHCAWL-Tourist Centre
page.content: When the harbour closed in 1906, Porthcawl began to grow in popularity as a tourist centre.Today it is a thriving holiday town,containing many protected coves. As well as the many natural features of the coastline,Porthcawl has many other attractions for the tourist.The remains of the old dock is now used as a small harbour and it is the centre of the Porthcawl Motorboat and Ski Club.Keen fishermen can find an extraordinary variety of fish in the area.There is a large Amusement Park,as well as many cafes,restaurants and hotels.To the east of the Amusement Park,is one of the largest caravan parks in Europe.In the main shopping area,housed in the old police station,there is a small museum.
